intro: Scleranthus caudiger, commonly known as the tawny scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Scleranthus caudiger is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
